result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Brandon L. Perry appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.  Defendant in custody.   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

127PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Rose.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am..   Bond continued as previously set (see previous bond entry). rb
